data.text:
Jacques Maria di Borbone, Principe di Parma1

M, #112271, b. 9 June 1922, d. 5 November 1964

Last Edited=10 May 2003

Consanguinity Index=3.08%

Jacques Maria di Borbone, Principe di Parma was born on 9 June 1922 at Longwy, France .1 He was the son of René Carlo Maria Guiseppe di Borbone, Principe di Parma and Margrethe Françoise zu Schleswig-Holstein-Sonderburg-Glücksburg, Princess of Denmark.1 He married Birgitte von Holstein-Ledreborg, Countess of Holstein-Ledreborg, daughter of Joseph von Holstein-Ledreborg, Count of Holstein-Ledreborg and Countess Christina Hamilton, on 9 June 1947 at Ledreborg, Copenhagen, Denmark .1 He died on 5 November 1964 at age 42 at Roskilde, Copenhagen, Denmark , killed in a road accident.1

He gained the title of Principe Jacques di Parma.1 He was given the name of Jacques Marie Antoine Robert Valdemar Charles Felix Sixte Ansgar di Borbone at birth.

Children of Jacques Maria di Borbone, Principe di Parma and Birgitte von Holstein-Ledreborg, Countess of Holstein-Ledreborg

Philippe di Borbone, Principe di Parma+1 b. 22 Jan 1949

Lorraine Charlotte di Borbone, Principessa di Parma1 b. 27 Jul 1951

Alain Jean di Borbone, Principe di Parma1 b. 15 May 1955

Citations

[S12] C. Arnold McNaughton, The Book of Kings: A Royal Genealogy, in 3 volumes (London, U.K.: Garnstone Press, 1973), volume 1, page 451. Hereinafter cited as The Book of Kings.

Birgitte von Holstein-Ledreborg, Countess of Holstein-Ledreborg1

F, #112272, b. 29 June 1922

Last Edited=9 Nov 2002

Birgitte von Holstein-Ledreborg, Countess of Holstein-Ledreborg was born on 29 June 1922 at Ledreborg, Denmark .1 She is the daughter of Joseph von Holstein-Ledreborg, Count of Holstein-Ledreborg and Countess Christina Hamilton.1 She married Jacques Maria di Borbone, Principe di Parma, son of René Carlo Maria Guiseppe di Borbone, Principe di Parma and Margrethe Françoise zu Schleswig-Holstein-Sonderburg-Glücksburg, Princess of Denmark, on 9 June 1947 at Ledreborg, Copenhagen, Denmark .1

She gained the title of Countess Holstein-Ledreborg.1

Children of Birgitte von Holstein-Ledreborg, Countess of Holstein-Ledreborg and Jacques Maria di Borbone, Principe di Parma

Philippe di Borbone, Principe di Parma+1 b. 22 Jan 1949

Lorraine Charlotte di Borbone, Principessa di Parma1 b. 27 Jul 1951

Alain Jean di Borbone, Principe di Parma1 b. 15 May 1955

Citations

[S12] C. Arnold McNaughton, The Book of Kings: A Royal Genealogy, in 3 volumes (London, U.K.: Garnstone Press, 1973), volume 1, page 451. Hereinafter cited as The Book of Kings.

Joseph von Holstein-Ledreborg, Count of Holstein-Ledreborg1

M, #112273

Last Edited=9 Nov 2002

Joseph von Holstein-Ledreborg, Count of Holstein-Ledreborg married Countess Christina Hamilton, daughter of Count Raoul Gustaf Hamilton and Christina Lovisa Beck-Friis.1

He gained the title of Count Holstein-Ledreborg.1

Child of Joseph von Holstein-Ledreborg, Count of Holstein-Ledreborg and Countess Christina Hamilton

Birgitte von Holstein-Ledreborg, Countess of Holstein-Ledreborg+1 b. 29 Jun 1922

Citations

[S12] C. Arnold McNaughton, The Book of Kings: A Royal Genealogy, in 3 volumes (London, U.K.: Garnstone Press, 1973), volume 1, page 451. Hereinafter cited as The Book of Kings.

Countess Christina Hamilton1

F, #112274, b. 2 December 1887, d. 26 April 1974

Last Edited=27 Jul 2018

Countess Christina Hamilton was born on 2 December 1887.2 She was the daughter of Count Raoul Gustaf Hamilton and Christina Lovisa Beck-Friis.2 She married Joseph von Holstein-Ledreborg, Count of Holstein-Ledreborg.1 She died on 26 April 1974 at age 86.2

Citations

[S12] C. Arnold McNaughton, The Book of Kings: A Royal Genealogy, in 3 volumes (London, U.K.: Garnstone Press, 1973), volume 1, page 451. Hereinafter cited as The Book of Kings.

[S6448] Bram Sonneveld, "re: Oppenheimer Family," e-mail message to Darryl Roger LUNDY (101053), 27 November 2012. Hereinafter cited as "re: Oppenheimer Family."

Michel di Borbone, Principe di Parma1

M, #112275, b. 4 March 1926, d. 7 July 2018

Last Edited=17 May 2020

Consanguinity Index=3.08%

Michel di Borbone, Principe di Parma was born on 4 March 1926 at Paris, France .1 He was the son of René Carlo Maria Guiseppe di Borbone, Principe di Parma and Margrethe Françoise zu Schleswig-Holstein-Sonderburg-Glücksburg, Princess of Denmark.1 He married Yolande de Broglie-Revel, Princesse de Broglie-Revel, daughter of Joseph de Broglie-Revel, Prince de Broglie-Revel and Marguerite de la Cour-Balleroy, on 9 June 1951 at Paris, France .2 He and Yolande de Broglie-Revel, Princesse de Broglie-Revel were divorced in 1966. He married, secondly, Maria Pia di Savoia-Carignano, Principessa d'Italia, daughter of Umberto II di Savoia-Carignano, Re d'Italia and Marie José de Belgique, Princesse de Belgique, in 2003.3 He died on 7 July 2018 at age 92 at Neilly-sur-Seine, France.

He gained the title of Principe Michel di Parma.1 He was given the name of Michael Marie Xavier Valemar George Robert Charles Aymard di Borbone at birth.

Children of Michel di Borbone, Principe di Parma and Yolande de Broglie-Revel, Princesse de Broglie-Revel

Ines di Borbone, Principessa di Parma+2 b. 9 May 1952, d. 20 Oct 1981

Erik di Borbone, Principe di Parma+2 b. 28 Aug 1953

Sybil Marie Josephine Anne Victorie di Borbone, Principessa di Parma2 b. 10 Nov 1954

Victoire di Borbone, Principessa di Parma+2 b. 8 Nov 1957

Charles Emmanuel di Borbone, Principessa di Parma+2 b. 3 Jun 1962

Child of Michel di Borbone, Principe di Parma and Laure le Bourgeois

Amélie de Bourbon-Parme4 b. 13 Mar 1977

Citations

[S12] C. Arnold McNaughton, The Book of Kings: A Royal Genealogy, in 3 volumes (London, U.K.: Garnstone Press, 1973), volume 1, page 451. Hereinafter cited as The Book of Kings.

[S12] C. Arnold McNaughton, The Book of Kings, volume 1, page 452.

[S3380] Patricia Ruijzendaal, "re: Austrian Royalty," e-mail message to Darryl Roger Lundy, 19 November 2008. Hereinafter cited as "re: Austrian Royalty."

[S130] Wikipedia, online http;//www.wikipedia.org. Hereinafter cited as Wikipedia.

André Marie di Borbone, Principe di Parma1

M, #112276, b. 6 March 1928

Last Edited=10 May 2003

Consanguinity Index=3.08%

André Marie di Borbone, Principe di Parma was born on 6 March 1928 at Paris, France .1 He is the son of René Carlo Maria Guiseppe di Borbone, Principe di Parma and Margrethe Françoise zu Schleswig-Holstein-Sonderburg-Glücksburg, Princess of Denmark.1 He married Marina Gacry, daughter of Paul Gacry and Yvonne Dessaules, on 2 May 1960 at Villafranche-sur-Mer, France , in a civil marriage, They were remarried in a religious ceremony on 9 May 1960 in Nice.2

He gained the title of Principe André di Parma.1

Children of André Marie di Borbone, Principe di Parma and Marina Gacry

Tania Sophie di Borbone, Principessa di Parma+3 b. 13 Nov 1961

Astrid di Borbone, Principessa di Parma3 b. 22 Sep 1964

Axel di Borbone, Principe di Parma3 b. bt Jun 1968 - Nov 1968

Citations

[S12] C. Arnold McNaughton, The Book of Kings: A Royal Genealogy, in 3 volumes (London, U.K.: Garnstone Press, 1973), volume 1, page 451. Hereinafter cited as The Book of Kings.

[S12] C. Arnold McNaughton, The Book of Kings, volume 1, page 452.

[S12] C. Arnold McNaughton, The Book of Kings, volume 1, page 453.

Philippe di Borbone, Principe di Parma1

M, #112277, b. 22 January 1949

Last Edited=10 May 2003

Philippe di Borbone, Principe di Parma was born on 22 January 1949 at Hellerup, Copenhagen, Denmark .1 He is the son of Jacques Maria di Borbone, Principe di Parma and Birgitte von Holstein-Ledreborg, Countess of Holstein-Ledreborg.1 He married Annette Smith, daughter of Carl Christian Smith and Lise Anderson, on 5 May 1979 in a morgantic marriage.

He gained the title of Principe Philippe di Parma.1

Citations

[S12] C. Arnold McNaughton, The Book of Kings: A Royal Genealogy, in 3 volumes (London, U.K.: Garnstone Press, 1973), volume 1, page 451. Hereinafter cited as The Book of Kings.

Alain Jean di Borbone, Principe di Parma1

M, #112278, b. 15 May 1955

Last Edited=10 May 2003

Alain Jean di Borbone, Principe di Parma was born on 15 May 1955 at Roskilde, Copenhagen, Denmark .1 He is the son of Jacques Maria di Borbone, Principe di Parma and Birgitte von Holstein-Ledreborg, Countess of Holstein-Ledreborg.1

He gained the title of Principe Alain di Parma.1 He was given the name of Alain Jean Knud Bernard Felix Maie Rene Joseph di Borbone at birth.

Citations

[S12] C. Arnold McNaughton, The Book of Kings: A Royal Genealogy, in 3 volumes (London, U.K.: Garnstone Press, 1973), volume 1, page 451. Hereinafter cited as The Book of Kings.

Lorraine Charlotte di Borbone, Principessa di Parma1

F, #112279, b. 27 July 1951

Last Edited=10 May 2003

Lorraine Charlotte di Borbone, Principessa di Parma was born on 27 July 1951 at Roskilde, Copenhagen, Denmark .1 She is the daughter of Jacques Maria di Borbone, Principe di Parma and Birgitte von Holstein-Ledreborg, Countess of Holstein-Ledreborg.1

She gained the title of Principessa Lorraine di Parma. She was given the name of Lorraine Charlotte Tatjana Ebba Jeanne Maria Antonia Josephine Renee di Borbone at birth.

Citations

[S12] C. Arnold McNaughton, The Book of Kings: A Royal Genealogy, in 3 volumes (London, U.K.: Garnstone Press, 1973), volume 1, page 451. Hereinafter cited as The Book of Kings.
